intro: Tragacantha jejuna, commonly known as the slender tragacanth, is a species of flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in racemes, followed by pod-like fruits containing several seeds. Tragacantha jejuna is adapted to survive in dry environments, with deep roots that help it access water from deeper soil layers. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of desert flora.
